summary: A regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) vulnerability was detected in terser 5.14.1, a transitive dependency used via webpack for build tooling. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 5.3 and is fixed in terser versions 4.8.1 and 5.14.2 or later.
userImpact: Users of the SDK are exposed to a potential denial of service vulnerability through a transitive dependency in the build pipeline.
rootCause: Insecure usage of regular expressions in terser library versions before 5.14.2 causing ReDoS vulnerability (CVE-2022-25858).
proposedFix: Upgrade terser to version 4.8.1 or 5.14.2 or later.
resolutionDetails: The issue was resolved by upgrading the terser dependency to a patched version that addresses CVE-2022-25858.
keyQuote: The package terser before 4.8.1, from 5.0.0 and before 5.14.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS)
